Class GymUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • GymUtility

  • public class GymUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an analytics class that only has static methods. It stores the calculateBMI, determineBMICategory and isIdealBodyWeight methods.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Dennehy (Student Number 20091408)

    • Method Detail

      • calculateBMI

        public static double calculateBMI(Member member,
                                  Assessment assessment)
        Method used to calculate the member's Body Mass Index (BMI). Calculation: BMI = Weight / (Height * Height)
        Parameters:
        member - The specific member object that is passed to the method. BMI will be calculated for this member. The member's height is used in this method.
        assessment - The assessment for the member that is passed to the method. The assessment weight is used in this method.
        Returns:
        The member BMI's value.

      • determineBMICategory

        public static java.lang.String determineBMICategory(double bmiValue)
        Method used to determine the Body Mass Index (BMI) category. Calculation: BMI Less than 16: SEVERELY UNDERWEIGHT BMI between 16 and 18.49: UNDERWEIGHT BMI between 18.5 and 24.99: NORMAL BMI between 25 and 29.99: OVERWEIGHT BMI between 30 and 34.99: MODERATELY OBESE BMI greater than or equal to 35: SEVERELY OBESE
        Parameters:
        bmiValue - The bmiValue that is passed to the method. Used to determine the BMI category.
        Returns:
        The correct BMI category for the BMI value passed to the method.

      • isIdealBodyWeight

        public static boolean isIdealBodyWeight(Member member,
                                        Assessment assessment)
        Used to determine if the member is at the ideal weight, considering their gender and their height and weight

        Calculation: Devine Formula Males: Ideal body weight is 50kg + 2.3kg for each inch over 5 feet. Females: Ideal body weight is 45.5kg + 2.3kg for each inch over 5 feet.

        NOTE: If no gender is specified, the female calculation for ideal body weight is used NOTE: If the member is less than 5 feet tall, 50kg is used as ideal body weight for males, 45.5kg for females. NOTE: To allow for different calculations and rounding, if the member weight falls between -0.2 to +0.2 of the ideal weight, the member is determined to have an ideal body weight.

        Member height is multiplied * 100 to get height in centimetres. Calculation: Centimetres to inches = Height in Centimetres * 0.393701

        The member height in feet is calculated Calculation: Inches to feet = inches / 12

        Excess inches for the calculation (i.e. inches over 5 feet) are determined. Calculation: Inches over 5 feet = total height in inches - 60 (5 * 12 inches)

        The number of inches over 5 feet is then multiplied to determine additional weight for the ideal weight calculation. Calculation: Additional weight for ideal weight calculation = Inches over 5 feet * 2.3

        The ideal weight is then calculated (dependent on gender as outlined above)

        A comparison is then made between the ideal weight (dependent on the member's gender) and the members weight (last assessment weight).

        If the weight falls within the specified range (+/- 0.2 of the ideal weight), the boolean value is true. Else it is false.

        Parameters:
        member - The specific member object that is passed to the method.
        assessment - The assessment for the method that is passed to the method. The assessment weight is used in this method.
        Returns:
        boolean value: true if the member is at the ideal weight, false if not.
